author: ralexstokes
content: has anyone thought about changes to the HTTP standard that would come under HF 1?

author: djrtwo
content: on that front, are we ready for a release of the http standard?

author: ralexstokes
content: we will likely want to add some ability to support new sync committee duties for validators

author: djrtwo
content: yeah, agreed. probably worth cutting a release soon and iterating for hf1

author: ralexstokes
content: unless i hear otherwise, i'll make a note to intro a PR for the new API

author: ralexstokes
content: it would also be nice to cut a release soon, esp if we want to keep phase 0 / HF 1 / ... symmetry

author: ajsutton
content: I'm assuming the API will have to support both pre and post fork data since you might be requesting a block or state from prior to the HF.

author: ralexstokes
content: i don't think that changes anything right?

author: ajsutton
content: Still makes sense to cut a release at this point I think, but I don't think we can just have v2 be specified in terms of the new HF data structures.

author: ajsutton
content: I don't think it's a big issue, just that the JSON schema for returned objects needs to explicitly support both formats (ie it's going to wind up with some optional elements)

author: ralexstokes
content: we could more strictly version v1, v2 ,etc and have "tight" types

author: ralexstokes
content: then it is on the caller to know which endpoint to call though

author: ajsutton
content: Yeah that's what I think we can't do without it becoming a massive pain for users of the API.
